definition: to dodge/to duck out of the way/to beat it/shaken (by a fall)/to sprain/to pull a muscle/lightning/spark/a flash/to flash (across one's mind)/to leave behind/(Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: The boy dodged behind a door so that we could not see him.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩闪身躲到门后，不让我们看见他。

sentences.english: The girl dodged behind a tree to hide from the other children.
sentences.chinese: 这女孩闪身躲到树后不让其他孩子看见。

sentences.english: She hit at  me, but I didn't let her touch me.
sentences.chinese: 她一拳向我击来，我闪身没让她碰到我。

sentences.english: Time of coming over already a Shan body gets into.
sentences.chinese: 过来的时候已经一闪身进入去。

sentences.english: He saw a policeman coming and ducked behind a car.
sentences.chinese: 他看到一个警察向他走来，便闪身躲在一辆汽车后边。

sentences.english: Hearing someone come in, he hid himself behind the curtain.
sentences.chinese: 听见有人进来了，他一闪身藏在了窗帘的后面。

sentences.english: Luciana vanished aboard one of the diminutive green vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 露西安娜闪身上了一辆绿色的小型汽车不见了。

sentences.english: A boxer learns to bob and weave.
sentences.chinese: 拳击手学习急速扭头和闪身。

sentences.english: To avoid my friend,I dodged under the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免和一个朋友见面，我闪身躲到了桥下。

sentences.english: The words fall, he namely a Shan body, fade to perish.
sentences.chinese: 话落，他一个闪身，消失不见。

sentences.english: She stopped the car and dodged into the nearest cafe.
sentences.chinese: 她停下车，闪身躲进了最近的咖啡馆。

definition: (idiom) no sooner said than done/before you know it
pinyin: shuo1 shi2 chi2 , na4 shi2 kuai4

definition: to get out of the way
